title: Titration curve weak acid - moles KOH equal to HA

content.question:
A solution of a weak monoprotic acid is titrated with a solution of a strong base, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>KOH</mtext></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahGart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGlbGaae4tai aabIeaaaa@3B69@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Consider the points labeled (A) through (D) on the titration curve that results, as shown below.

The point at which the moles of the added strong base are equal to the moles of the weak acid initially present

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
